intro: Zappania mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican zappania, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Zappania mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
